title: ECB Tightening Path Is in ‘Home Stretch,’ Guindos Tells Sole
description: The European Central Bank is in the final leg of its historic cycle of interest-rate increases, according to Vice President Luis de Guindos.

title: G-7 Finance Chiefs Unite to Condemn Russia and Counter China
description: Under the shadow of swelling risks to the global economy, finance chiefs from the world’s wealthy nations presented a united front with more support for Ukraine, a plan for diversifying supply chains and a vow to fill gaps in financial regulation.

title: Israel and Gaza Strip Militants Reportedly Close to Ceasefire
description: A senior Islamic Jihad leader said Egyptian-led negotiations have produced an agreement with Israel to end a military conflict that began earlier this week.

title: Biden Says Democracy Remains Under Attack in Howard Speech
description: President Joe Biden cast American democracy as under attack, echoing themes from both his 2020 campaign and his nascent reelection bid in a speech at Howard University’s commencement ceremony.

title: Biden Says Debt Talks Moving Along as Parties Discuss Changes
description: President Joe Biden said budget talks to avert a catastrophic US default are moving along and that negotiators will know more in the coming days.

title: Germany Avoids Travel Disruptions as Court Settlement Is Reached
description: Germany averted a nationwide train strike after state-owned Deutsche Bahn took the EVG union to labor court in a bid to resolve wage talks that have been dragging on for almost three months.

title: EU Strives to Win a Bigger Say in China’s Backyard
description: The European Union offered closer political and investment ties to some 20 countries from across the Indo-Pacific region, as the bloc seeks more influence despite ever-growing Chinese and US ambitions.

title: Trump, DeSantis to Crisscross Iowa in Early GOP Nomination Test
description: Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis’s increasingly bitter rivalry will play out in Iowa on Saturday, setting up one of the most direct contrasts yet in what may become a battle for the Republican nomination for president.

title: Clashes in Pakistan, Ukraine Makes Bakhmut Gains: Weekend Reads
description: Pakistan’s former premier, Imran Khan, was granted two weeks bail in a corruption case by the Islamabad High Court, the latest twist in a political drama that’s fueled violent clashes across the country.

title: UK’s Hunt Plans Fast Access to Deposits in Cases of Bank Failure
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said consumers and companies need to be able to access their money quickly in the event of a bank collapse, as the UK government seeks to learn from the failure of California’s Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Arrives in Rome to Meet Italy Prime Minister
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived in Rome on Saturday to meet Italian President Sergio Mattarella, Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, and Pope Francis.

title: Liverpool holds Eurovision Song Contest final, with Sweden favored and Ukraine in spotlight
description: LIVERPOOL, England (AP) — What includes a Swedish diva, a Finnish rapper who loves pina coladas, a band of Croatian agit-rockers and an Austrian duo possessed by a long-dead writer? It could only be the Eurovision Song Contest.

title: Germany Announces Record €2.7B in Military Aid for Ukraine
description: Germany is preparing new military aid for Ukraine worth more than €2.7 billion ($2.9 billion), including tanks and anti-aircraft systems, the country’s defense ministry said ahead of a possible visit by President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

title: Thai Opposition Poised to Dislodge Military Coalition, Pita Says
description: Thailand’s pro-democracy opposition parties have the momentum to dislodge a coalition of conservative parties headed by Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-Ocha, according to Pita Limjaroenrat, whose liberal Move Forward party has seen a late surge in support ahead of Sunday’s vote.

title: Charting the Global Economy: US Inflation Cools; BOE Hikes Rates
description: US inflation showed more signs of moderating in April, giving the Federal Reserve room to pause interest-rate increases soon.

title: Ukraine Latest: Germany Announces Record €2.7B in Weapons Aid
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will meet with Pope Francis, Italy’s prime minister and other top officials during a visit to Rome and the Vatican on Saturday, before traveling to Berlin. Germany is preparing a a military aid package for Ukraine worth some €2.7 billlion, the nation’s defense ministry announced.

title: Twitter to Restrict Some Content in Turkey Ahead of Sunday Vote
description: Twitter said it has taken action to restrict access to some content in Turkey ahead of presidential and parliamentary elections on Sunday.

title: Suella Braverman 'Advised to Scrap Asylum Seekers Plan for Air Base'
description: Home Secretary Suella Braverman was advised to scrap plans to house asylum seekers at a former RAF base, it has been reported.

title: Hunt Says US Debt Impasse Poses Serious Threat for World Economy
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt warned the US debt ceiling impasse poses a serious risk for the global economy.

title: Germany Economy Will Be Missing 7 Million People by 2035
description: Germany's Labor Minister Hubertus Heil told lawmakers in April that the economy will be missing up to 7 million workers by 2035 – roughly the population of Berlin, Hamburg and Munich combined. In response, Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s governing coalition has said it wants to attract 400,000 qualified workers from abroad each year. Oliver Crook reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Modi’s Party Trails in Early Vote Count in India Swing State
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party is trailing in the crucial southern state of Karnataka in early vote counting, indicating that his ruling party could have a tough fight on its hands as it looks to win a third term in national elections next year.

title: Record Voter Turnout Predicted When Thais Vote on Sunday
description: A record number of Thais are projected to go to the ballot boxes in Sunday’s parliamentary election as voters decide if they’ll shift leadership away from almost a decade of military-backed rule.

title: Germany Is Experiencing a Mass Worker Shortage. Can Migration Fix It?
description: Sipping Turkish black tea outside the doner shop he runs in the Berlin neighborhood of Kreuzberg, Faruk Can reflected on the many new faces he’d noticed in the area.

title: G-7 Finance Chiefs Boost Ukraine Aid, Propose Supply Chain Plan
description: Group of Seven finance chiefs put more aid on the table for Ukraine, set up a new supply chain initiative and vowed to fill regulatory gaps in the banking sector in a show of unity on global geo-economic issues after three days of talks.

title: US Transportation Department Discloses Data Breach
description: The US Transportation Department said it had been hit by a data breach involving its administrative systems.

title: Patel, Dorries and Rees-Mogg to Attend 'Tory Democracy' Conference
description: Several high-profile and Boris Johnson-backing Tory MPs will be among the attendees at a conference on Saturday pledging to restore democracy to the Conservative grassroots.

title: Petro Says Colombia Must Respond to High Rates With Tariffs
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro urged commercial banks to cut interest rates on loans and added that central bank interest rate hikes put the “productive economy” at risk.

title: Chinese Brokerage Head Resigns After Reported Missing for Weeks
description: Chinese brokerage Zheshang Securities Co. said it received a resignation letter from its President Wang Qingshan, reported by local media as missing since late March.

title: Yellen to Update Congress on Default Timing Within Two Weeks
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she expects to update Congress within the next two weeks on how close the federal government is to defaulting on its financial obligations.

title: South Korea, UK Commit to Cooperate on Reinforcing Supply Chains
description: South Korea and the United Kingdom agreed to bolster economic security cooperation and to fortify critical supply chains, amid the US-led initiative to diversify the global supply chain away from China.

title: Ex-ByteDance Exec Claims Reporting Illegal Conduct Got Him Fired
description: ByteDance Inc.’s former head of engineering in the US said in a lawsuit he was fired for voicing concerns to management that the TikTok owner was stealing copyrighted content from other platforms including Instagram and Snapchat. He also alleges the company fabricated users to exaggerate its metrics and help the China’s Communist Party spread propaganda to a larger audience.
